action.action-desc: Mr. Armstrong (for himself and Mr. Pappas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To establish the Rural Export Center, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Promoting Rural Exports Act of 2023.

paragraph.text: Rural businesses are often located far from information clusters and major transportation corridors.
Because of their location, rural businesses face higher barriers to accessing international markets.

A dedicated Rural Export Center within the United States and Foreign Commercial Service providing business- and product-specific support can help companies in the United States looking to export their products.

section.header: Establishment of the Rural Export Center

paragraph.text: The term Assistant Secretary means the Assistant Secretary of Commerce and Director General of the United States and Foreign Commercial Service appointed pursuant to section 2301(a)(2) of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 (15 U.S.C. 4721(a)(2)).
The term Commercial Service means the United States and Foreign Commercial Service established under section 2301(a)(1) of the Export Enhancement Act of 1988 (15 U.S.C. 4721(a)(1)).

subsection.header: Establishment of the Rural Export Center

paragraph.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Assistant Secretary shall establish a Rural Export Center (in this section referred to as the Center) for the purpose of providing businesses located in rural areas in the United States with resources to help those businesses export their products.

subparagraph.text: The Center shall be established at an office of the Commercial Service in the United States in existence before the date of the enactment of this Act.
In selecting a location for the Center, the Assistant Secretary shall give preference—

clause.text: based on expertise and operations at Commercial Service offices that support rural businesses exporting to new markets before the date of the enactment of this Act; and
to such offices not located in major metropolitan areas.

subparagraph.text: Any researcher or staff directly supporting the operation of the Center shall be primarily based at the Center.
provide in-depth, customized, and actionable market research services that—

clause.text: a business may opt into based on need; and

subclause.text: focused on actionable and measurable results for a business;
targeted to not more than 3 international markets;
based on high-quality data, including data from international trade association subscription databases; and

based on market analysis and export services of the Commercial Service available before the date of the enactment of this Act, including the Rural America's Intelligence Service for Exporters program; and

subparagraph.text: conduct strategic planning and export support services for rural businesses as needed.

paragraph.text: To measure the effectiveness of the Center, the Center shall collect and make available data on—

subparagraph.text: the number of businesses that sign up for market research assistance;
the number of export assistance services a business engages in following the research assistance, including—

clause.text: other services facilitated by the Center; and

subparagraph.text: the total monetary value of exports facilitated by the services provided by the Center.

paragraph.text: The Center shall maintain an internet website that includes—

subparagraph.text: best practices for rural businesses beginning to evaluate export opportunities; and
appropriate contact information for staff at the Center.
